body.p: at the last Term of the Taylor Circuit Court a fine of $50 & costs was assessed against Nathaniel Tandy. for Some abusive Language used to Ben S Smith & wife by a Party of drunken men who were passing sd. Smiths house in the night. Tandy was accidentally in company and Smith who has long been on unfriendly Terms with Tandy presented him to the Grand Jury with the balance -- all were tried together leaveing Tandy no opportunity to prove his Innocence -- I know the Parties well and from what I know of Smiths character & disposition and the unfriendly feelings existing between the families are Satisfyed that the presentment against Tandy was a piece of little petty malice & spite on the part of Smith --

Tandy is a harmless Inoffensive man and poor & unable to pay sd fine without great Inconvience. to himself & Family -- He sent you a Petition last fall praying for a Remittance of the fine Signed by a number of the best citizens of this county but has not heard from it since.
Mr. Chandler made some enquiry for it in Frankfort, but it could not be found on file and has probably miscarried. I am there fore Induced to address you privately on the subject.

Verry Respectfully
yours.
Wm. L Turner

Thos E. Bramlette Esq
Governor of Kentucky
Dear Sir

I am Satisfied, the Statements of the within letter of Dr Turner are true, and I think he ^Tandy^ is a fit subject for Executive clemency, which I hope he will receive, He forwarded his petition numerously signed which is perhaps on file in your office. I think Col J. T. Bramlette had chge of it.

This Most respectfully
Your Obdt Servant
J H Chandler

Taylor Cir Court
vs
N. Tandy
Remit except fees & costs -- I know Tandy well and am satisfied from my personal knowledge of the man that he took no part in any wrong
